material.mattext: Agile methodology is a sequential approach to software development.
Agile methodology is an iterative approach to software development.
Agile methodology is a circular approach to software development.
Agile methodology is a prototype approach to software development
How much time does each iteration in agile methodology take?
Does agile methodology ask user's feedback?
Which of the following are the responsibilities of a Scrum master role in agile methodology?
Scrum master is a team leader.
Scrum master helps other members included in the project to work with agile methodology.
Scrum master is responsible for planning meetings regularly.
Do you think user requirements and tasks are both the same?
Do you think the agile methodology is best suitable for a small development project?
Which of the following is/are the advantages of using agile methodology?
Does every iteration in agile methodology go through a testing phase?
Which framework helps the team to work together?
A product is built in a series of repetitions called ____
Are agile and scrums the same?
Does every iteration in agile methodology go through a testing phase?
Which of these is NOT a principle of the Agile Manifesto?
Individuals and interactions over processes and tools
Responding to change over following a plan
Which of the following are correct quality strategies of agile?
Which of the following is not true about Software Validation?
Validation ensures the product under development is as per the user requirements.
Validation does not emphasize on user requirements.
Validation is carried out at the end of the SDLC.
Which of the following is true about Software Verification?
Verification ensures the product being developed is according to design specifications.
Verifications concentrate on the design and system specifications.
In which type of testing : software is compiled as a product and then it is tested as a whole?
Which chart represents the amount of work remaining in the project?
Which chart represents the amount of work done in the project?
Which of the following consist of the rapid explanation of all the functionalities desired in the product?
Which of the following are involved in releasing the plan?
In Agile, 'refactoring' refers to which practice?
Modifying code to improve structure without changing behavior
Which technique is commonly used in Agile for discovering and addressing defects early in the software development process?
What is the role of a 'Scrum Master' in maintaining software quality?
_____ is the process of evaluating a system or its component(s) with the intent to find whether it satisfies the specified requirements or not. 8C. Software Testing
Validation is a process done by?
Which of the following are valid step in SDLC framework?
Which of the following is not correct model in Software Development Paradigm?
Waterfall model is not suitable for:
Which one of the following is a functional requirement?
Which of the following activity is not timeboxed?
What happens when all the Sprint Items cannot be completed?
The Sprint ends with the done items
The unfinished Sprint items should be removed from the Sprint Backlog
Start the next Sprint with the unfinished items first
Who should necessarily attend the Daily Standup meeting?
The Development Team and the Product Owner
The Development Team and the Scrum Master
The Scrum Team and the Stakeholders
What do we mean by a cross-functional Development Team?
Each of the Development Team members should be cross-functional
The developer should able to create test cases and execute them
The Development Team should collaborate with the other Development Teams
The Development Team consist of Developers and Testers
The Development Team should have all the skills necessary to deliver the Done Increment
Activity to seek approval for the work done
Activity to plan for the next Sprint
Activity to plan for the release
What is done during a Sprint Review Meeting?
Discuss the architectural and technical aspects of the project
The team discusses the improvements that can be applied for the upcoming sprints
Present the Projectâ€™s performance to the Stakeholders
Inspect progress towards the Sprint Goal
What is not the significance of determining a Definition of Done?
Determines the objective behind each sprint
Increments delivered are more effective and potentially releasable
Develops a common understanding amongst all the team members as to what all needs to be completed to mark every item complete.
In Scrum, when is a Sprint Over?
When all the Sprint Backlog Items are completed
When all the Sprint Backlog tasks are completed
When the final testing is completed
What is not a main responsibility of a Scrum Master?
Facilitating meeting as and when requested
Helps the Product Owner order the Product Backlog
Consulting the Development Team and Product Owner
What is not a main responsibility of a self-organizing development team?
Estimate the items to be picked up for the upcoming Sprint
Who is responsible for measuring the Projectâ€™s performance?
What should a Development Team do during a Sprint Planning meeting when they have realized that they have selected more than the items they can complete in a Sprint?
Seek help from the other Scrum Team Members
When can a Sprint be canceled?
The Sprint items are no longer needed
When Development is unable to complete the work
Information required to start the development is not available
When is a Sprint Retrospective ceremony performed?
At the end of each Sprint
Product Backlog should be ordered on the basis of?
Value of the items being delivered
The complexity of the items being delivered
Size of the items being delivered
The risk associated with the items
Based on the Scrum Team choice
Which of the following is delivered at the end of the Sprint?
A document containing test cases for the current sprint
An architectural design of the solution
Select the option that suits the Manifesto for Agile Software Development
Agility is defined as the ability of a project team to respond rapidly to a change.
How is plan driven development different from agile development ?
Outputs are decided through a process of negotiation during the software development process
Specification, design, implementation and testing are interleaved
Agile methods seem to work best when team members have a relatively high skill level.
Which of the following does not apply to agility to a software process?
Only essential work products are produced
Eliminate the use of project planning and testing
Incremental development in Extreme Programming (XP) is supported through a system release once every month.
In XP, as soon as the work on a task is complete, it is integrated into the whole system.
User requirements are expressed as __________ in Extreme Programming.
Is a customer involved in test development and validation in XP ?
It may vary from Customer to Customer
Tests are automated in Extreme Programming .
In XP an automated unit test framework is used to write tests for a new piece of functionality before that functionality itself is implemented.
Developers work individually on a release and they compare their results with other developers before forwarding that release to customers.
Which four framework activities are found in Extreme Programming(XP) ?
Purpose of process is to deliver software
both in time & with acceptable quality
Which of the following activities provides a feedback report?
If a software production gets behind schedule, one can add more programmers and catch up.
Choose an internal software quality from given below:
The only deliverable work product for a successful project is the working program.
. Which of the following does not affect the software quality and organizational performance?
The intent of project metrics is:
assessing project quality on ongoing basis
minimization of development schedule and assessing project quality on ongoing basis
Size and Complexity are a part of
Cost and schedule are a part of
Metric is the act of obtaining a measure.
Which of the following terms describes testing?
Software Debugging is a set of activities that can be planned in advance and conducted systematically.
Validation refers to the set of tasks that ensure that software correctly implements a specific function.
How many phases are there in Scrum ? a) Two b) Three c) Four d) Scrum is an agile method which means it does not have phases
How many phases are there in Scrum ?
Scrum is an agile method which means it does not have phases
In agile development it is more important to build software that meets the customersâ€™ needs today than worry about features that might be needed in the future.
In XP Increments are delivered to customers every _______ weeks.

Programmers prefer programming to testing and sometimes they take shortcuts when writing tests. For example, they may write incomplete tests that do not check for all possible exceptions that may occur.
What are the types of quality requirements ?
Which one of the following is not a step of requirement engineering?
A Use-case actor is always a person having a role that different people may play.
A stakeholder is anyone who will purchase the completed software system under development.

Which one of the following is a functional requirement ?
Which one of the following is a requirement that fits in a developerâ€™s module ?

Functional requirements capture the intended behavior of the system.

Requirements analysis is critical to the success of a development project.
Depends upon the size of project
Requirements should specify â€˜whatâ€™ but not â€˜howâ€™.
Which is the first step in the software development life cycle ?
finding and correcting errors in the program code
identifying the task to be computerized
In the Design phase, which is the primary area of concern ?
The importance of software design can be summarized in a single word which is:
Cohesion is a qualitative indication of the degree to which a module
is able to complete its function in a timely manner
is connected to other modules and the outside world
Coupling is a qualitative indication of the degree to which a module
is able to complete its function in a timely manner
is connected to other modules and the outside world
Which of the properties of software modularity is incorrect with respect to benefits of software modularity?
Modules Can be separately compiled and stored in a library
is a measure of the degree of interdependence between modules.
A software engineer must design the modules with the goal of high cohesion and low coupling.
Which of the following does not affect the software quality and performance?
The intent of project metrics is:
assessing project quality on ongoing basis
minimization of development schedule and assessing project quality on ongoing basis
Which of the following is not a direct measure of Software engineering process?
In size oriented metrics, metrics are developed based on the ___________________
Usability can be measured in terms of:
Intellectual skill to learn the system
Time required to become moderately efficient in system usage
Which of the following is not a project management goal?
Delivering the software to the customer at the agreed time
Maintaining a happy and well-functioning development team
Project managers have to assess the risks that may affect a project.
Which of the following is not considered as a risk in project management?
The process each manager follows during the life of a project is known as
Which of the following is/are main parameters that you should use when computing the costs of a software development project?
effort costs (the costs of paying software engineers and managers)

What describes the data and control to be processed?

Which of the following risk is the failure of a purchased component to perform as expected?
What assess the risk and your plans for risk mitigation and revise these when you learn more about the risk?
Risk management is now recognized as one of the most important project management tasks.
Project management involves the planning, monitoring, and control of the people, process, and events that occur as software evolves from a preliminary concept to an operational implementation.
Which of the following is not an effective software project management focus?
Which of the following is not a project managerâ€™s activity?
Who defines the business issues that often have significant influence on the project?
Who delivers the technical skills that are necessary to engineer a product or an application?
Which of the following is a people-intensive activity?
Which of the following is not an approach to software cost estimation?
Who interacts with the software once it is released for production use?
Which of the following is not an effective project manager trait?
Commitments to unrealistic time and resource estimates may result in
Which of the following is not a project factor that should be considered when planning the structure of software engineering teams?
The difficulty of the problem to be solved
High frustration caused by personal, business, or technological factors that causes friction among team members
The degree of sociability required for the project
The rigidity of the delivery date
